headline.print_headline: Limited Options to Keep Children From Terrorism
headline.main: Only Hard Choices for Parents Whose Children Flirt With Terror

snippet: Hoping for an intervention, Sal Shafi cooperated with the government when his son showed warning signs of radicalization. A year later, his son was in handcuffs, facing 20 years in prison.
abstract: United States government offers few options to those concerned that loved ones or acquaintances are being lured into terrorist activity, leaving many with agonizing decision over whether to turn suspects over to authorities; Sal Shafi's desperate attempt to help his son Adam by calling FBI illustrates fallout from such limitations.
